title: Practice Challenge
description:
Create a simple gradebook:
1. Create an array of test scores: [85, 92, 78, 95, 88]
2. Display the first score (index 0)
3. Display the last score (use .length - 1)
4. Calculate and display the average score (sum all, divide by length)
instructions:
Create a simple gradebook:
1. Create an array of test scores: [85, 92, 78, 95, 88]
2. Display the first score (index 0)
3. Display the last score (use .length - 1)
4. Calculate and display the average score (sum all, divide by length)

hints.text: First: scores[0], Last: scores[scores.length - 1], Average: sum all in loop, divide by scores.length

commonMistakes.consequence: scores[1] returns the second item, not the first.
commonMistakes.correction: Arrays are zero-indexed: scores[0] is the first item.

commonMistakes.mistake: Using scores[scores.length] for the last item
commonMistakes.consequence: Returns undefined since there's no item at that index.
commonMistakes.correction: Use scores[scores.length - 1] to get the last item.

commonMistakes.mistake: Dividing by a hardcoded number instead of length
commonMistakes.consequence: Average is wrong if the array size changes.
commonMistakes.correction: Use total / scores.length for a flexible solution.
